intro: Acetosella mallobolba, commonly known as the lesser springbeauty, is a low-growing perennial herb belonging to the Primulaceae family. It is characterized by its small, showy white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically has a basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Acetosella mallobolba is often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
